sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Morrison is being referred for further assessment and management of persistent fatigue, unintentional weight loss, and intermittent low-grade fever over the past two months.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports feeling increasingly fatigued, with episodes of low-grade fever (up to 37.8°C) and an unintentional weight loss of 4 kg over eight weeks. She denies night sweats, cough, or recent travel. No significant gastrointestinal or urinary symptoms. Over-the-counter analgesics have provided minimal relief.

sections.heading: Relevant Medical History
sections.content: History of hypothyroidism, well-controlled on levothyroxine. No known allergies. No prior hospitalizations or surgeries.

sections.heading: Current Medications
sections.content:
- Levothyroxine 75 mcg daily
- Multivitamin once daily

sections.heading: Physical Examination
sections.content: Vital signs stable. BMI 22.5. Mild pallor noted. No lymphadenopathy or organomegaly detected. Cardiovascular and respiratory exams unremarkable.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Recent bloodwork: mild normocytic anemia (Hb 10.8 g/dL), normal renal and liver function tests, TSH within therapeutic range. ESR mildly elevated at 38 mm/hr.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the constellation of symptoms and mild anemia, further evaluation is required to rule out underlying chronic inflammatory or hematologic conditions. Kindly assess and advise on further management.
